parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From agon; to struggle, literally, figuratively, or genitive case.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
From ago; properly, a place of assembly, i.e. a contest; figuratively, an effort or anxiety.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To lay hold of, take hold of, seize (sometimes with beneficent, sometimes with hostile, intent).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From aion; perpetual.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From a compound of the base of homou and logos; to assent, i.e. Covenant, acknowledge.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
A profession, confession. From the same as homologeo; acknowledgment.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
Much, many; often.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.
